intro: Conopharyngia johnstonii, commonly known as the Johnston's conopharyngia, is a rare and lesser-known member of the Conopharyngiaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its delicate, linear leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in temperate forest understories. Its reproductive structures are specialized, with the fruiting bodies producing spores for dispersal. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a sensitive indicator of ecological health.
